Latisha
We are trying to revamp our Special Event Policies and Procedures here on Tybee Island and would love to coordinate with you guys, our neighbors from over the bridge. Please feel free to contact Chantel Morton at 786-4573 and see what we can help with. I guess we have the same problems with essentially the same vendors.

answers.author: Michael Repas
answers.text:
Hi Latisha:
I was able to find several examples of polices and licenses by local governments (and they all pertain to your specific needs, including special events like Halloween, or zoning concerns), and I have posted them to the Knowledge Network for your ease of access:
-Somerville, MA “Guide to Transient Vendor Licenses” http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301457/Guide_to_Transient_Vendor_Licenses 
-Salem, MA “One-Day Transient Vendor Application for Halloween 2008” http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301458/Oneday_transient_vendor_application__Halloween_2008_Salem_MA
-Warrensburg, MO “Transient/Itinerant Merchants/Vendors Application” http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/301459/TransientItinerant_MerchantsVendors_Application__Warrensburg_MO 
I hope this helps!

author: Latisha Thomas
text: The City of Savannah is currently looking at ways to improve our city-wide temporary/transient vending policy, as it relates to zoning, revenue, public engagement, and special events. Do you have any useful information or best practices in this subject area that can be shared with others?
title: Temporary Vending
